Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un simulateur d'insultes, en multiplayer (1vs1) local. Très basique, c'est un prototype réalisé lors d'un game jam.

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

C'est amusant, 5 minutes. Et puis ça se répète...

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Pour un prototype réalisé en moins de 48h, c'est impressionnant. Mais ça n'a aucun intérêt :).

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

Le jeu fonctionne parfaitement sur Linux.

OS: Linux Mint 18.3 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

25242665.review:
[b]Rating:[/b] [i]2.1/10[/i]
[b]Paid:[/b] [i]NZ$0.00[/i] (Free-To-Play)
[b]Review:[/b]

[u]OK, when writing this review at first I had no idea this was a "prototype", because [i]Oh...Sir!: The Insult Simulator[/i] was looked at more like a sequel[/u].

Oh...Sir! is a "game" where you have to try roast the other person with your pro-comebacks skills and try knock their health out. The game gives you some sentence starters and random phrases to put into your sentence.

This game made me want to fall asleep, and it's only 4:47pm.

The sentences are weird and if someone was to say them to me in real life, I would probably say something like "Seriously? That's the best you could come up with?".

The "cutscenes" before and after are not even related to this. The guy on the right comes in, says his parrot is dead, feels sad about it, then the game starts with the cringy comebacks, then afterwards, you say "Go to my brothers, he'll give you a parrot" and the other guy says "Ok, I will go to your brothers".

The game isn't even multiplayer, it's pretty much split-screen, as you can't play this game with friends on different computers, even though that would be awesome.

There's also a points system, which isn't really a points system, as it knocks out your opponents "health" bar. The points system is really stupid. I could say "Your parrot is dead" for 8 points.

But I do have to give kudos for the voice. Any sentence you put together will be read aloud. Shame that he doesn't sound that enthusiastic, more like someone who's been convinced to say a bunch of random phrases into a microphone was hired as voice actor.

And it doesn't go on for long, can be a good thing or bad thing depending on how you enjoy the game. I've played 5 minutes at the time of reviewing this.

I guess it all comes down to how much you like bad comebacks. If you find them hilarious then click the "Play Game" button, but if you're like me and the bad comebacks make you want to tell the other person to just get lost, then give this a miss.

22212934.review:
The premise is a shoddy rip-off of the famous Monty Python "dead parrot" sketch in theory, and in several forceful references to dead parrots, hamsters, smelling of elderberries and so on.  The voice recording is awful quality, the sentence fragments fit together very jarringly, and the people doing the recording are clearly not comfortable enough with English to make you believe it's actually the characters speaking.  The layout is a little offputtinig, with no form of instruction or help as to how it all works short of trial and error.  The graphics are passable for a goofy little game like this, but give nothing worth remembering.

TL;DR: cute idea, roughly executed.

21974555.review: Oh...Sir! Is a hiarious turn based linguistic puzzle game of sorts. The storyline is like something straight out of a Montey Python bit, whereas a constumer has returned to the show from which he has purchased an ex-parrot, it is no more, it has ceased to be. Players take turns exchanging insults piece by piece. A turn is completed when a player has selected a short phrase from a joint word bank or a personal work bank or when their time has run out. A round ends when both players are ready to insult eachother or when there are no more phrases left to be had. The game ends when one of the two player's HP bars reaches zero. The game is actually rather fast paced with limited time to read options and decide on the best course of action before time expires on your turn. For a game completed in 42 hours it's actually pretty awesome. I would have liked a handful of more phrase options through which to cycle for subsiquent rounds of play, but again, 42 hours. The voiceovers in the game are okay, nothing spectacular, but the worst is the bla bla... sound effect. Overall, decent game in short doses, very funny, well worth the download since it's free to play.

21598374.review:
This is a game of whose insults earn more points. You need someone else to play against. The game gives you a selection of nouns, verbs, adjectives, etc, and you must choose them in the correct order so as to make a proper (i.e. grammatically correct) sentence. So the game is actually more about "forming correct English sentences" rather than finding the best insult, because the options you get to pick from are entirely random.

E.g. You may be given "and", "is a hamster", "still uses Windows Vista", "your mother", "your favourite Bond actor", "the African swallow", "is interested in photography", etc. If you're just starting a sentence, you have no choice but to select either "your mother", "your favourite Bond actor", or "the African swallow". And if you've already selected a noun, the next option you pick can only be "is a hamster", "still uses Windows Vista" or "is interested in photography". And so on. 

It's quite fun only because there's a timer - you have to be fast in choosing the next sentence connector! If you choose wrongly (e.g. Your current sentence is "Your mother..." and you pick "your father" next, so the sentence becomes "Your mother your father"), then your sentence will no longer make any sense and it'll be wrong and you'd have wasted a turn!

Recommended entirely because it's free, quite different from other games, and fun in a silly way.

20981702.review:
Oh...Sir! - игра, вышедшая 21 декабря 2015 года, разработанная студией Vile Monarch, представляет из себя симулятор "культурного" спора между двумя пиксельными джентльменами. Игроку открываются поистине невероятные возможности...ВЫБИРАТЬ ФРАЗЫ, составляя из них наиболее обидное и абсурдное высказывание, которое определённо должно затронуть чувства оппонента. Это ведь так интересно, учитывая то, что фраз в игре всего около 20 и из них можно составлять ВЕСЁЛЫЕ и СМЕШНЫЕ комбинации...ведь так? Нет ._. 
Разработчики решили, что игрокам понравится поочерёдно играть за сэров, пытаясь как можно круче полить другого помоями из словесных отрывков, а когда надоест, игроки всегда смогут позвать друга и посоревноваться с ним, кто составит фразу из ОДИНАКОВЫХ, БЛЕАН, ОТРЫВКОВ забавнее. Но нет. Может кому-то это и интересно, но для меня - сомнительное удовольствие. Поражаюсь. как этот отстой вообще прошёл Steam Greenlight? Как по мне, так Oh...Sir! является одной из худших инди разработок за 2015 год. Ни толкового геймплея, ни сюжета, сидишь просто как идиот и "Your hat is fat" ахахах)))00)) "Your math teacher is your father" кееек))0)0 
Кароч, это полный бред, оценивая эту игру, я бы поставил 3 из 10 и то, только за сносное пиксельное оформление, отсутствие ценника на этой "игре" и достойное музыкальное сопровождение. У меня всё.
                   Это написал Лисс.

This game.

If this had network support and a bigger base of sentence fragments, plus a few other polishes and niceties you'd expect from a very small retail game, I'd buy it for 5 bucks no questions asked.

As it is, it's free, so that's ok too.

Most hilarious two player couch minigame I have ever seen.
Also, Monty Python.

Create insults out of a random selection of sentence fragments, and make them as insane as possible.
But you still need to observe basic grammar so your insult has to make "sense".
If you add a sentence fragment that doesn't make sense gramatically, your toon will fumble and stutter and the insult will fail.

Your opponent (or yourself if you are living alone, you sad person) does the same, turn wise.
When you feel your insult is insane and stupid and silly enough, you press the button and both cartoon gentlemen will speak their insult.

More rules apply, but you should really just find that out yourself.

All within a setting of the famous Monty Python "Dead Parrot" sketch, with quite a few iconic other Python fragments such as "The African Swallow".

10/10

20512365.review: Ultimamente noto che molti giochi progettati in poche ore durante una game jam vengono perfezionati e rilasciati (quasi) sempre gratuitamente qui su Steam. I risultati veramente eccellenti fanno arrivare alla conclusione che in questo mercato sia più deleteria la troppa ambizione rispetto alla mancanza di tempo, che costringe l'uomo a circoscrivere le proprie idee e razionalizzare i propri mezzi. Oh...Sir! è un piccolo gioco multiplayer in locale arrivatoci da un team slavo. Il titolo prende diretta (direttissima oserei dire) ispirazione da "The parrot sketch" tratto dal Flying circus di Monty Python: consiglio veramente a tutti di cercarlo su youtube e goderselo (sono 5 minuti) prima di avviare questo prodotto. Il concept è abbastanza simile a quello di Last Word di Twelve Tiles: occorre sconfiggere il proprio avversario a suon di parole, in questo caso decisamente... offensive. L'offesa in Oh...Sir! è limitata da un set precostituito di carte, che andranno parzialmente distribuite in tavola e in minima porzione (due) in mano a ciascun giocatore. Obiettivo è formare frasi sintatticamente plausibili (i coordinatori andranno a ruba!), possibilmente con un bell'enfatizzatore finale (da qui il titolo); il danno che l'avversario riceverà se completerete una frase corretta sintatticamente sarà proporzionato alla coerenza semantica dei costituenti. In questo senso Oh...Sir! è un gioco molto interessante dal punto di vista linguistico e capisco perfettamente perché il set di item usabili sia abbastanza limitato. L'effetto comico è comunque assicurato, con sintagmi adatti a un'atmosfera assolutamente più "contemporanea" rispetto al contesto da gentlemen britannici di altri tempi che viene proposto a schermo; stessa comicità di contrasto si ricaverà dalla prosodia decisamente slava dei doppiatori che si sforzano un po' goffamente di essere il più "British" possibile. Un piccolo bug (o è voluto?) confonde a volte i turni dei due giocatori, con il pappagallo stecchito che indica una persona diversa rispetto a quella evidenziata dalla luce: questo però è senza dubbio un non-problema in un gioco in cui una spallata in più al vostro avversario che inavvertitamente ha scelto qualcosa di poco adatto rispetto ai vostri piani non è altro che un motivo di divertimento in più. In definitiva, ben consci delle limitazioni strutturali di un gioco che sembra ricercare un certo grado di coerenza, mi piacerebbe veramente vedere questo sistema di combattimento esteso a una campagna single player con tante situazioni e parole in più. Nel frattempo, Oh...Sir! ha una longevità direttamente proporzionale non alla quantità dei suoi contenuti, ma alle persone disposte a farsi due risate per una mezz'oretta in vostra compagnia.

[i] Лирическое отступление [/i]: помню когда я был мелкий, стоило выйти за хлебушком и постоять в очереди, чтобы узнать много новых витиеватых ругательств, потом придя с хлебушком домой, и включив телек, можно было увидеть еще более изощренные варианты срача, в любой из телепрограмм - в тех же "Окнах" с Нагиевым. Далее появились ммо-игры на пиратских серваках, масштабы срача увеличивались. Теперь же благодаря этому симулятору в перебранку можно даже сыграть! Я так понимаю что будущие поколения будут изучать взаимосрач в полном 3D, с продвинутой симуляцией запахов перегара и потных носков оппонента.

[i] Про игру [/i]: была раньше такая игра как "Пираты острова обезьян" - так вот, тамошний герой Гайбраш Трипвуд в дуэлях костерил врагов страшными словами, и чем витиеватее эти слова были, тем больше шансов было забороть врага. Здесь то же самое, только английские джентельмены до дуэлей не снисходят, и выглядит все не так интересно. Игра была сделана двумя польскими товарищами для очередного джема "сделай игру за 48 часов", в связи с чем функционал здесь минимальный - нужно поочередно из предложенных слов составлять хитромудрое ругательство, пока оппонент не помрет от обиды. Причем ни сцена, ни герои несменяемы. Тем не менее если играть в компании с друзьями игра может быть и занимательна минут на 15. Но особой содержательности в ней нет.

20383910.review:
Oh...Sir! is a self-styled multi player insult game. It is a variant of the game consequences, where players take it in turns to complete a phrase from fragments given onstcreen. The score is calculated by the computer and your opponent is wounded by an amount dependin gon how sucessful your insult was. Its fun, but I broke the game in 5 minutes, running out of insults for one side. Even with his health depleted the game did not end. 
Its quite funny at times, using many phrases from Monty Python, however the scoring seems somewhat arbitrary and the random combination produces some surreal insults: Your cousins car is your father... seemed to be the phrase that killed the game.

All in all, the game is an amusing diversion, and is free to play. I would recommend taking a look.

+ Fun local multiplayer humour like similar card games.

- The music gets on your nerves before the jerky movement of the characters does.
- The voice acting is terrible and more akin to the Hungarian-English Dictionary sketch than the Dead Parrot sketch.
- No pause menu.
- No graphics settings menu.
- ESC exits the game without a prompt.
- Local multiplayer with an unforgiving timer, causing issues with passing on the mouse.

tl;dr; 3/10

20186757.review:
[h1]OH...SIR! - Your mother is your father and your hamster ![/h1]

[b]Anmerkung: Die Bewertungen des Reviews wurden durch einen garstigen Troll-Hater verzerrt.[/b]

HANDLUNG:
Wer kennt die Situation nicht ? Gerade hat man sich in der Tierhandlung seines Vertrauens einen neuen Papagei geleistet und kurze Zeit später ist dieser tot. Logische Konsequenz: Nichts wie zurück zum Verkäufer und diesem ordentlich seine Meinung geigen. Aus einem kleinen Pool an Satzstückchen basteln wir uns nun die perfekte Beleidigung zusammen, bis wir unser Gegenüber durch unsere Sprachgewalt in Grund und Boden getreten haben. Das Spiel ist dabei ausschließlich im lokalen Multiplayer spielbar. Die Rolle unseres Kontrahenten muss also in jedem Fall ein Freund übernehmen. 

GRAFIK:
Die Grafik ist in Oh...Sir! absolut nebensächlich. Trotzdem wirkt der charmante Pixel-Stil durch und durch stimmig.

LEVELGESTALTUNG: 
Abwechselnd wählen beide Spieler ein bis zwei Satzbausteine aus dem Pool, um eine möglichst pfeffernde Beleidigung zu kreieren. Das Spiel bewertet dann die Beleidigungs-Stärke und zieht nach und nach Punkte aus der Lebensleiste ab. Außerdem gibt es noch einige weitere kleine Features, die etwas mehr Komplexität in die Sache bringen. Durch die gut gewählten Satzbausteine lassen sich einige blödsinnige und witzige Beleidigungen erschaffen.

UMFANG:
Leider enthält das Spiel aber nur wenige Satzteile; dadurch hat man nach einigen Durchgängen schon alles gesehen. Schade, hier wäre noch mehr drin gewesen. Außerdem sind Runden, wie schon erwähnt, nur im lokalen Multiplayer möglich.

BALANCE:
Die Bewertungen der Beleidigungen und die damit verbundenen Minuspunkte für die gegnerische Lebensleiste fallen überraschend plausibel aus. Nur selten habe ich mich hier ungerecht bewertet gefühlt. Auch die Bedienung durch eine einzige Maus funktioniert gut. 

ATMOSPHÄRE:
Die fertiggestellten Beleidigungen werden durch eine Person mit starkem russischen Akzent vorgetragen. Das ist in diesem Fall aber nicht weiter schlimm, sondern eher belustigend und trägt, zusammen mit der auch sonst etwas fragwürdigen Soundkulisse, zur trashigen Stimmung bei.

WEITERES:
Das Spiel ist komplett kostenlos.

FAZIT:
[h1]Komisches, witziges und kurzweiliges Spiel mit interessantem Spielkonzept und wenig Umfang für eine unterhaltsame halbe Stunde mit Freunden ![/h1]

WERTUNG: [h1]70[/h1]

Not too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes instead

Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 tablespoons sugar
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg
2 large eggs, at room temperature
1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature
1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as needed

Now to make it
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.
2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla.
3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat.
4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed
5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed.
6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

This game is a simple fun game.

It's far from perfect.  It doesn't isolate controls from the two players, it lacks controller or keyboard suppert, and it's generally more a simple proof of concept than a full game.

Honestly, the bigest fault is that it could REALLY use a computer-controlled oponent.  

However, it is a lot of fun, even by yourself, it's a small download, and it's completely free.

Furthermore, it has a dry, blunt, silly, humor straight out of the Monty Python and other sketch comody shows.  If that is enough to get you to download it, you'll have some fun with this game.

While I probably wouldn't pay for this game, (or at least wouldn't pay much for it or pay for it individually) it is a fun game none-the less, and would honestly make a very good mini-game as part of any other game.

4: Lack of keyboard controls means that both players either need to share the same mouse (or whatever you use) or two mice, either way allowing for tons of cheating.

Major Things:

1: The scoring system. It's broken. Really, really broken. My opponent insulted me by saying "That dog is a english dog pig, I bet!" (which would actually harm his own health) and I insulted him by saying "You are vile, sir!" and he scored a ton more than me. If you don't see what's wrong there...
2: Some word combinations that should work don't, such as "Your hovercraft talks to strangers and your hat, mate!" doesn't work because it wants a verb after "your hat", so when I tried picking "mate!" it damaged me for making a bad choice... what!?
3: You know what I said about the airplane this game was made in? Yeah, it's also a major thing.

This is just an overview of the several problems I encountered while playing this for about half an hour.
If your game's point is to have revolutionary game mechanics, yet those same mechanics are broken to the core... your game truly sucks.
As I said, good concept, horrible execution.
If these problem were fixed (which I doubt as games made within a timelimit don't tend to update), this game would be great. I just don't want to bother anymore because I'll get less points for saying something short and direct ("You and your father are vile!") versus something longer and completely stupid and irrelevant ("That dog is a dead parrot, and I have proof!"). WHICH MAKES NO SENSE FOR A GAME WHOSE ENTIRE GAMEPLAY REVOLVES AROUND THIS MECHANIC

19844858.review:
"Oh...Sir!" has a very interesting gameplay mechanic...It's basically about two elegant pixelated gentlemen arguing about a dead parrot. A 2-player game where the winner is determinated by the one who has the best insult. The better the insult, the higher your chances to win. For example: "Your mother still uses windows vista, sir!" or "Your father is stone dead". It's not anything revolutionary, but it's funny. It's a game developed in a very short time, so don't expect anything with superb quality, specially because it's a free game. And this aspect is notably cheap in terms of voice acting. But, thinking about it, the cheap voice acting is part of it's awkward charm.
If you have someone to play "Oh...Sir" with, you will have a lot of fun. And by a lot of fun, I mean you will play it for about 15 minutes, and then probably you will delete it from your Steam library. Not because it's bad, just because it doesn't have a lot of content (or any content at all), and after this 15 minutes you will notice that the insult options are very limited. But still, give it a try. Those 15 minutes will be awkwardly funny. 
But make yourself a favor, if you are going to play it alone, don't even think to download it. Or the gameplay value will reduce to 5 minutes. Because trying to insult yourself isn't very fun. But maybe you have a different definition of what's "fun".

Recommandé, en coopération locale avec des amis :) !

Deux gentlemen ont un différent (on dirait le début d'une mauvaise blague :D), le premier accusant le commis-vendeur de lui avoir livré un perroquet mort. S'ensuit alors une bataille de logorrhées mémorables. Chaque joueur choisissent à tour de rôle, dans le tableau central ou dans leur main (qu'ils peuvent remplacer en buvant du thé... quel cliché :) !) les mots qui constitueront leur insulte absurde : "Your wife and your mom still use Windows Vista" :D. Il suffit de regarder les commentaires dédiés à ce jeu pour apprécier les meilleures créations ! L'anglais peut constituer une barrière, mais peut s'en faut pour trouver rapidement ses marques ^^.

Règles simples, situations grotesque, graphisme parodique, sur fond de musique qui attise votre flamme de gentleman. Que demande le peuple ? Il rit avec ses amis, et c'est un très bon début :D.

19837205.review:
Greetings fellow gamers! This is Gamer Guy (In a Suit) from the Echo Army YouTube channel! Today I am bringing you a review of the new Free-To-Play game on Steam, Oh...Sir! Oh....Sir! was released on Steam on December 21st, 2015 by Developer Vile Monarch and Publisher Gambitious Digital Entertainment.

Video Review: 

https://youtu.be/lDp48htyflc

The "Too Long, Didn't Watch" Review:

It is Free, it was made in 42 hours. Funny concept, could use more lines. 2/5

The "Meat & Potatoes" Review:

It take a second to realize the turn-patter/rhythm of the game. It is actually a pretty cool and funny concept that could very easily be developed into a fantastic game. As is, the dialogue is SEVERELY limited. Do keep in mind, this game was made in a mere 42 hours and is also quite free. It is worth a try. Go give it a few clicks, spend about 5-10 minutes with it. Hell, I could even see it being a fun drinking game as is. Great concept and I would LOVE to see a fully fleshed out, online-multiplayer version. Maybe even with a random partner drawn for each round. All things considered, 2/5 simply because it's likely you'll try it, love the concept, but not play the game again.

Happy Gaming!
